sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都含"懂，知道，明了"之意。
means: know ： 普通用词，多指通过学习、经验或他人传播而得到知识，含直接知道的意味。
learn ： 通常指通过他人而获得消息或情况，侧重从不知到知的变化过程。
comprehend ： 侧重熟悉了解的过程。
understand ： 指对事物已有彻底的认识，不仅知其性质、含义和细节，而且了解其内外的关系。

list.explanation: (做某事的)实际知识、本事、技术、技巧

example.en: It takes know-how to run that thing.
I don't have the know-how to do this.
That little creep over there always thinks he knows all the answers.
example.zh: 那边那个小家伙老是以为自己样样都通。

example.en: She doesn't bother any more. She knows all the answers.
example.zh: 她不再烦恼，全都看透了。

list.explanation: (常用于否定句)彻底了解(一件事)

example.en: Even your doctor doesn't have all the answers.
example.zh: 你的病就连你的医生也并不完全了解呐。

list.explanation: 知情的，熟悉内幕的，消息灵通的

example.en: Sure,I'm in the know. But I'm not telling.
example.zh: 当然，我熟知内情。不过现在我不能说。

example.en: Ask Harry. He's usually in the know.
example.zh: 请教哈里吧。 他总是消息很灵通。

list.explanation: 什么也不懂，信息不灵，得到错误情报

example.en: Tom doesn't know from nothing. He is really dense!
example.zh: 汤姆啥也不懂，真是笨透了!

example.en: He's been at the job for two years but still doesn't know his way around.
example.zh: 这工作他虽然已经干了两年，但还是不大懂门道。

example.en: It's bad, all right. Don't I know it!

be wise or polite enough to avoid doing a particular thing
jx.jx_cn_mean: 变聪明些，不再相信，不再上当

lj.lj_ly: you ought to know better than to ask that.
lj.lj_ls: 你应该变聪明些，别问此事。

jx.jx_en_mean: recognize someone by their appearance without knowing their name or being so well acquainted as to talk to them

entry.def: If you know a fact, a piece of information, or an answer, you have it correctly in your mind.

example.ex: I don't know the name of the place...
example.tran: 我不知道那个地方的名字。

example.ex: I know that you led a rifle platoon during the Second World War...
example.tran: 我知道你在二战期间率领一个步枪排。

entry.def: If you know someone, you are familiar with them because you have met them and talked to them before.

example.ex: Gifford was a friend. I'd known him for nine years...
example.tran: 吉福德是我的一位朋友。我和他认识9年了。

example.ex: Do you two know each other?...
example.tran: 你们俩互相认识吗？

entry.def: If you say that you know of something, you mean that you have heard about it but you do not necessarily have a lot of information about it.

example.ex: We know of the incident but have no further details...
example.tran: 我们听说过这件事，但对详情不是很清楚。

example.ex: The president admitted that he did not know of any rebels having surrendered so far...
example.tran: 总统承认据他所知迄今为止还没有反叛者投降。

entry.def: If you know about a subject, you have studied it or taken an interest in it, and understand part or all of it.

example.ex: Hire someone with experience, someone who knows about real estate...
example.tran: 雇佣有经验、了解房地产业的人。

example.ex: She didn't know anything about music but she liked to sing.
example.tran: 虽然她对音乐一无所知，但却爱唱歌。

entry.def: If you know a language, you have learned it and can understand it.

example.ex: It helps to know French and Creole if you want to understand some of the lyrics...
example.tran: 如果你想读懂一些抒情诗，学点法语和克里奥尔语是有帮助的。

example.ex: Rachel already knows as many words in German as she does in English...
example.tran: 雷切尔掌握的德语词汇已经和她掌握的英语词汇一样多了。

entry.def: If you know something such as a place, a work of art, or an idea, you have visited it, seen it, read it, or heard about it, and so you are familiar with it.

example.ex: No matter how well you know Paris, it is easy to get lost...
example.tran: 不管你对巴黎多么熟悉，也很容易迷路。

example.ex: I don't know the play, I've just come to see it.
example.tran: 我不了解这部剧，只是来看看。

entry.def: If you know how to do something, you have the necessary skills and knowledge to do it.

example.ex: The health authorities now know how to deal with the disease...
example.tran: 卫生部门现在知道如何对付这种病了。

example.ex: We know what to do to make it work.
example.tran: 我们知道如何让它起作用。

entry.def: You can say that someone knows that something is happening when they become aware of it.

example.ex: Then I saw a gun under the hall table so I knew that something was wrong...
example.tran: 后来我看到大厅的桌子下有一把枪，我就意识到有些不对劲儿。

example.ex: The first I knew about it was when I woke up in the ambulance.
example.tran: 当我从救护车中苏醒过来时才知道发生了什么事。

entry.def: If you know something or someone, you recognize them when you see them or hear them.

example.ex: Would she know you if she saw you on the street?...
example.tran: 如果她在大街上看到你，能认出你吗？

example.ex: I thought I knew the voice.
example.tran: 我觉得在哪里听过这声音。

entry.def: If someone or something is known as a particular name, they are called by that name.

example.ex: The disease is more commonly known as Mad Cow Disease...
example.tran: 这种疾病更通俗的名称是疯牛病。

example.ex: He was born as John Birks Gillespie, but everyone knew him as Dizzy...
example.tran: 他本名为约翰·伯克斯·吉莱斯皮，但人人都叫他“小迷糊”。

entry.def: If you know someone or something as a person or thing that has particular qualities, you consider that they have those qualities.

example.ex: Lots of people know her as a very kind woman...
example.tran: 很多人认为她是个非常善良的女人。

example.ex: We know them as inaccurate and misleading property descriptions...
example.tran: 我们认为对性状的这些描述是不准确的，且会使人产生误解。

entry.def: If you know someone as a person with a particular job or role, you are familiar with them in that job or role, rather than in any other.

example.ex: Most of us know her as the woman who used to present the television news...
example.tran: 我们大多数人认识她是因为她曾主持过电视新闻节目。

example.ex: The soldiers — all of whom we knew as neighbours — stood around pointing guns at us.
example.tran: 那些士兵——我们都视之为邻居的人——站在四周用枪指着我们。

entry.def: If you talk about a thing or system as we know it, you are referring to the form in which it exists now and which is familiar to most people.
entry.tran: 现行的；我们熟悉的；我们熟知的

example.ex: He planned to end the welfare system as we know it.
example.tran: 他计划终止现行的福利制度。

example.ex: ...those values of our culture that are essential to civilisation as we know it.
example.tran: 我们文化中那些构成我们所熟悉的文明社会之根基的价值观

entry.def: If you get to know someone, you find out what they are like by spending time with them.

example.ex: The new neighbours were getting to know each other...
example.tran: 新邻居之间正在互相了解。

example.ex: I'd really like to see you again and get to know you better.
example.tran: 我很愿意再次见到你并且更多地了解你。

entry.def: People use expressions such as goodness knows ,Heaven knows, and God knows when they do not know something and want to suggest that nobody could possibly know it.

example.ex: 'Who's he?' — 'God knows.'
example.tran: “他是谁？”——“天晓得。”

example.ex: Old Gunga spoke God knows how many languages...
example.tran: 老贡嘎会说很多种语言，天晓得有多少种。

entry.def: You say 'I know' to show that you agree with what has just been said.
entry.tran: （表示同意）我理解，我有同感，我知道

example.ex: 'This country is so awful.' — 'I know, I know.'
example.tran: “这个国家太糟糕了。”——“的确是，的确是。”

entry.def: You say 'I know' to show that you accept that something is true, but think that it is not very important or relevant.

example.ex: 'There are trains straight from Cambridge.' — 'I know, but it's no quicker.'
example.tran: “有直接从剑桥开出的列车。”——“我知道，但也不快。”

entry.def: You use 'I know' to express sympathy and understanding towards someone.
entry.tran: （表示同情和理解）我理解，我知道

example.ex: I'm sorry, George. I know how you feel...
example.tran: 我很遗憾，乔治。我理解你的感受。

example.ex: I know what you're going through.
example.tran: 我知道你正在经受什么样的煎熬。

entry.def: You can use I don't know to indicate that you do not completely agree with something or do not really think that it is true.
entry.tran: 不知道，不认为（表示不完全同意或不认为是真的）

example.ex: 'He should quite simply resign.' — 'I don't know about that.'
example.tran: “他就该辞职。”——“我不知道。”

example.ex: I don't know that it's made the decision any easier.
example.tran: 我不认为这对作出决定有丝毫帮助。

entry.def: You can say 'I don't know about you' to indicate that you are going to give your own opinion about something and you want to find out if someone else feels the same.
entry.tran: 我不知道你（们）怎么想（表示将表达自己想法并想知道他人的看法）

example.ex: I don't know about the rest of you, but I'm hungry...
example.tran: 我不知道你们怎么样，但我是饿了。

example.ex: I don't know about you, but I've had just about enough of this.
example.tran: 我不知道你怎么想，但我已经受够了。

entry.def: You use I don't know in expressions which indicate criticism of someone's behaviour. For example, if you say that you do not know how someone can do something, you mean that you cannot understand or accept them doing it.
entry.tran: （表示批评某人的行为）真想不到，真不知道

example.ex: I don't know how he could do this to his own daughter...
example.tran: 真想不到他竟对自己的女儿这样。

example.ex: I don't know how you can say that...
example.tran: 真想不到你竟说那话。

entry.def: People sometimes use expressions such as I'm blessed if I know or damned if I know to emphasize the fact that they do not know something.
entry.tran: 我要是知道就好了；我根本不知道

example.ex: 'What was that all about?' — 'Damned if I know.'
example.tran: “那都是关于什么的？”——“我要知道就好了。”

example.ex: I'm damned if I know what plans he has in that direction.
example.tran: 我压根不知道他在那方面有什么计划。

entry.def: If you are in the know about something, especially something that is not known about or understood by many people, you have information about it.
entry.tran: 知情；（尤指）熟悉内幕，掌握内情

example.ex: It was gratifying to be in the know about important people...
example.tran: 了解重要人物的一些内幕真令人高兴。

example.ex: He takes crucial decisions without consulting people in the know.
example.tran: 他没有咨询相关知情人士就作了重要的决定。

entry.def: You can use expressions such as you know what I mean and if you know what I mean to suggest that the person listening to you understands what you are trying to say, and so you do not have to explain any more.
entry.tran: （表示所说的话对方理解）你是知道的，你知道我的意思

example.ex: None of us stayed long. I mean, the atmosphere wasn't — well, you know what I mean...
example.tran: 我们都没呆太久。我的意思是，气氛并不是——唔，你知道我的意思。

example.ex: She was a bit stuck up, know what I mean?
example.tran: 她有点自命不凡，你明白我的意思吧?

entry.def: You say 'You never know' or 'One never knows' to indicate that it is not definite or certain what will happen in the future, and to suggest that there is some hope that things will turn out well.
entry.tran: （指可能会发生好事）很难说，很难预料

example.ex: You never know, I might get lucky...
example.tran: 很难说，我也许会交好运呢。

example.ex: There might be an even bigger one — I doubt it, but you never know.
example.tran: 可能还有个比这还要大的——我觉得有点悬，但也很难说。

entry.def: You say 'Not that I know of' when someone has asked you whether or not something is true and you think the answer is 'no' but you cannot be sure because you do not know all the facts.

example.ex: 'Is he married?' — 'Not that I know of.'
example.tran: “他结婚了吗？”——“据我所知没有。”

entry.def: You can say 'How was I to know?', or in British English 'I wasn't to know', to mean that you cannot be blamed or criticized for something you did, because you did not have enough information to realize that it was wrong.

example.ex: How was I to know you'd return so suddenly?...
example.tran: 我怎么知道你会这么突然就回来?

example.ex: You weren't to know — in fact, I think I'm the only person who does know.
example.tran: 你不会知道——实际上，我想我是唯一真正知道的人。

entry.def: You can use expressions such as What does she know? and What do they know? when you think that someone has no right to comment on a situation because they do not understand it.
entry.tran: （某人）知道什么，懂什么（表示其没有资格评论）

example.ex: Don't listen to him, what does he know?...
example.tran: 别听他的，他知道什么？

example.ex: I always felt his attitude was, 'What do you know about it?'
example.tran: 我感觉他总是那种“你懂什么？”的态度。

entry.def: People sometimes say 'What do you know!' when they are very surprised about something.
entry.tran: （表示惊讶）你看怪不怪，真没想到

example.ex: Well, what do you know!
example.tran: 哎呀，真没想到！

entry.def: You use you know to emphasize or to draw attention to what you are saying.
entry.tran: （加强语气或引起注意）你要知道

example.ex: The conditions in there are awful, you know...
example.tran: 你要知道，那里的条件很艰苦。

example.ex: You know, it does worry me.
example.tran: 你要知道，这实在让我担心。

entry.def: People use you know when they are uncertain about what they are saying or what they are going to say next.
entry.tran: （表示不确定要说的话或考虑接着说什么）你知道

example.ex: He's generous and, you know, very nice, very polite...
example.tran: 他很大方而且，你知道，很友善，很有礼貌。

example.ex: I thought I'd, you know, have a chat with you.
example.tran: 我想我应该，呃，和你谈谈。

entry.def: You use you know when you are trying to explain more clearly what you mean, by referring to something that the person you are talking to knows about.
entry.tran: （表示进一步解释）你是知道的，你难道不知道

example.ex: Wear the white dress, you know, the one with all the black embroidery.
example.tran: 穿那件白裙，你知道的，上面有黑色刺绣的那件。

entry.def: You can say 'You don't know' in order to emphasize how strongly you feel about the remark you are going to make.
entry.tran: （加强语气）你不知道，你都想不到

example.ex: You don't know how good it is to speak to somebody from home.
example.tran: 你不知道和家乡来的人说说话感觉有多好。

means.word_mean: 1. be cognizant or aware of a fact or a specific piece of information; possess knowledge or information about;

sentences.sentence: "I know that the President lied to the people"
"I want to know who is winning the game!"
"I know it's time"

means.word_mean: 2. know how to do or perform something;

sentences.sentence: "She knows how to knit"
"Does your husband know how to cook?"

means.word_mean: 3. be aware of the truth of something; have a belief or faith in something; regard as true beyond any doubt;

sentences.sentence: "I know that I left the key on the table"
"Galileo knew that the earth moves around the sun"

means.word_mean: 4. be familiar or acquainted with a person or an object;

sentences.sentence: "She doesn't know this composer"
"Do you know my sister?"
"We know this movie"
"I know him under a different name"
"This flower is known as a Peruvian Lily"

means.word_mean: 5. have firsthand knowledge of states, situations, emotions, or sensations;

sentences.sentence: "I know the feeling!"
"have you ever known hunger?"
"I have lived a kind of hell when I was a drug addict"
"The holocaust survivors have lived a nightmare"
"I lived through two divorces"

means.word_mean: 6. accept (someone) to be what is claimed or accept his power and authority;

sentences.sentence: "The Crown Prince was acknowledged as the true heir to the throne"
"We do not recognize your gods"
"I know Latin"
"This student knows her irregular verbs"
"Do you know the poem well enough to recite it?"
"This student sleeps with everyone in her dorm"
"Adam knew Eve"
"Were you ever intimate with this man?"

means.word_mean: 9. know the nature or character of;

sentences.sentence: "we all knew her as a big show-off"

means.word_mean: 10. be able to distinguish, recognize as being different;

sentences.sentence: "The child knows right from wrong"
"I know this voice!"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English cnāwan (earlier gecnāwan) 'recognize, identify', of Germanic origin; from an Indo-European root shared by Latin (g)noscere, Greek gignōskein, also by can and ken

sentences.en: I'd really like to see you again and get to know you better.

sentences.cn: 了解重要人物的一些内幕真令人高兴。
sentences.en: It was gratifying to be in the know about important people...

sentences.cn: 正如加州大学圣地亚哥分校的遗传医学教授詹姆斯·福勒所说,“大多数人甚至不了解他们的第四代表亲，却不知因何会选择和好像亲属的人结交朋友。
sentences.en: As James Fowler, professor of medical genetics at UC San Diego, says, Most people do not even know their fourth cousins but somehow manage to select as friends the people who resemble our kin.

sentences.cn: 或许这就是我们要探索星空的原因,就好像是在回应一个原始召唤，即了解我们自己和我们的祖先的真正家园。
sentences.en: Perhaps that is why we explore the starry skies, as if answering a primal calling to know ourselves and our true ancestral homes.

sentences.cn: 因此他应该了解情况。
sentences.en: So he should know.

sentences.cn: 即使不了解信息的具体内容，但其发送者及以及接收者的（身份）信息在极大程度上也会透露内情，且这种情况仍会继续
sentences.en: Even without knowing what was in the messages, the knowledge of who sent them and to whom was enormously revealing and still could be.

sentences.cn: 在需要建筑者和操作员之前，可能最先需要一位设计师或管理者，而且每一组接受培训的工人都需要了解在毕业之后有工作等着他们。
sentences.en: One needs the designers, and perhaps the  regulators , before the builders and operators, and each group of workers in training has to know there is work waiting beyond graduation.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 下面让我们看看上述参众两院的两项议案中一些意图解决上述问题的重要计划方案，了解一下为什么难以知晓这些计划方案效果如何。
sentences.en: Here are some of the important proposals in the  House and Senate bills to try to address those problems, and why it is hard to know how well they will work.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第二套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: Flack 说现在下定论还太早，我们尚不了解充足的食物带来的好处是否大于在垃圾填埋场觅食的危险。
sentences.en: Flack said it was too early to know whether the benefits of plentiful food outweighed the risks of feeding on landfills.
sentences.from: 17年6月六级真题（第三套）| 阅读
